did.unittitle: 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration Collection
did.abstract: The 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration Collection, c. 1901-2009, contains materials and souvenirs associated with the commemorative celebration. The Hudson-Fulton Celebration commemorated the 300th anniversary of Henry Hudson’s discovery of the Hudson River and the 100th anniversary of Robert Fulton’s first successful commercial application of the paddle steamboat. The collection was created by Allen Fink and Susan Bette Fink (nee Budson). They devoted years to researching and collecting Hudson-Fulton Celebration items to create a comprehensive collection of materials telling the event's story.

bioghist.p: The Hudson-Fulton Celebration commemorated the 300th anniversary of Henry Hudson's discovery of the Hudson River and the 100th anniversary of Robert Fulton's first successful commercial application of the paddle steamboat. The collection was created by Allen Fink and Susan Bette Fink (nee Budson). They devoted years to researching and collecting Hudson-Fulton Celebration items to create a comprehensive collection of materials telling the event's story. The Fink's collection was recognized for its excellence while featured in a 2009 exhibition celebrating the 100th anniversary of the 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration at the New York State Museum in Albany. Allen Fink (1934-2020), a native of Brooklyn, NY, and Passaic, NJ, was born in 1934. Allen attended public school until he left school and home at 16. He worked various odd jobs - laborer, butcher's apprentice, tool, and dye-maker until he joined the United States Air Force at 19. While in the USAF, Allen went to school to become a radar technician. Later, he served 18 months in Morocco, working for Strategic Air Command. He explored the various cities nearby and learned about the history and local customs. Although Allen had not finished high school, he continued his education through reading, always going to the local library in his community or near his military base, reading anything and everything. Upon returning to New Jersey in 1959, he attended classes to complete his GED. Under the Veteran's GI Bill, Allen entered the Newark Institute of Technology, now the New Jersey Institute of Technology. During his college years, he worked one summer in Israel, affiliated with Technion, the Israel Institute of Technology, on telephone communications systems. During this time of national insecurity, he was required to become a temporary resident to do work in Israel. Allen's travels sparked an interest in history, and he began collecting stamps during travel from various locations. This led to his lifelong passion for collecting other materials, including postcards, coins, maps, prints, toys, comic books, and other types of ephemera. His specialties included the United States, France, the Hudson-Fulton Celebration, Early Flight, Zeppelins, the Civil War, and Judaica. Allen married Enid Reisberg of Newburgh, NY, and they had two children, Steven and Joli Anna. He then continued his education and earned a Master's degree in Industrial Management from Union College. After college, he began working in the Eclipse Pioneer Division of Bendix Aviation Corporation. In 1964, after several years in Advanced Research and Development, Allen left Bendix and joined International Business Machines (IBM) in Poughkeepsie, NY. At IBM, he worked in the research and development of mainframes until his retirement in 1993. After Allen retired from IBM, he continued to pursue his passion for collecting. In 1997, he married Susan Budson, who joined him in his varied endeavors, including table tennis and competition, and shared his passion for collecting. Post-retirement, Allen joined Vassar College as their Table Tennis Coach, was an active member of Vassar Temple, and taught classes at IBM and Marist College Center for Lifetime Studies. In his life, Allen encouraged people to pursue their interests and passions, learn, and be the best they could be.

scopecontent.p: The 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration Collection, c. 1901-2009, features materials associated with the commemorative celebration. The Hudson-Fulton Celebration commemorated the 300th anniversary of Henry Hudson’s discovery of the Hudson River and the 100th anniversary of Robert Fulton’s first successful commercial application of the paddle steamboat. The celebration occurred between September 25th and October 9th, 1909. The jubilant celebration surrounded the achievements of both Hudson and Fulton and the importance of the Hudson River to New York City and New York State. Events took place at various locations along the Hudson River from North New Jersey to Upstate New York over the course of two weeks. The various items in the collection showcase how Americans celebrated and revered the event. The collection contains postcards, photographs, advertising, medallions, plaques, pennants, medals, pins, badges, books, and many other items commemorating the 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration.

prefercite.p: [Description of item, date, location of item in order of series, box number, folder number ], in the 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration Collection, Archives and Special Collections, James A. Cannavino Library, Marist College.

arrangement.p: Collection is arranged into 11 series: 1) Postcards, 2) Photographs, 3) Souvenirs and Plates, 4) Spoons, 5) Textiles, 6) Publications, containing two subseries, 7) Coins, 8) Badges, Medals, and Pins, containing two subseries, 9) Fobs, 10) Musical Instrument- Zither, 11) Miscellany

did.unittitle: 1. Postcards

scopecontent.p: Postcards and commemorative USPS materials associated with and created for The 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration.

did.unittitle: Fidelity Trust Co. Bank of Livonia Postcard

scopecontent.p: Postcard contain Hudson Fulton Celebration Program historical fact on “Public Burning of the Newspapers 1733.” Front depicts colonial scene of Hudson River Valley’s Bank of Livonia in Livonia, NY

did.unittitle: Greene County Day Postcard

scopecontent.p: Depicts black and white image of celebration on the Hudson in Catskill, NY on October 6, 1909. Card contains advertisement for Catskill tourism.

did.unittitle: Fishkill-on-Hudson Postcard

scopecontent.p: Depicts black and white image of Mount Beacon and Incline Railroad. Advertisement for Fishkill tourism and Hammond’s “Cattle Comfort” Product.

did.unittitle: Alfred Benjamin & Co. Troop A Postcard

scopecontent.p: Depicts color image of Troop A as they move up 5th Avenue in New York City. Postcard courtesy of Alfred Benjamin and Co.

did.unittitle: Fulton Trust Co. Tuck’s Postcard

scopecontent.p: Postcard contains a short bio for Robert Fulton and the proposed program for the Hudson Fulton Celebration. Front color image is a textured depiction of Robert Fulton with a model of his "Clermont."

did.unittitle: Hudson-Fulton Flag Postcard

scopecontent.p: Front color image depicts the Dutch East India Company flag used by Henry Hudson on his voyage up the Hudson. Card is an advertisement for the sale of the reproduction flag by William G. White.

scopecontent.p: Souvenir plate featuring Dutch delft-style blue and white art of the NYS Capitol in Albany, NY, the Poughkeepsie Bridge in Poughkeepsie, NY, Washington’s Headquarters in Newburgh, NY, the Old Senate House in Kingston, NY, Grant’s Tomb in NYC, and Fulton’s “Clermont”. Bottom reads “Souvenir of Hudson-Fulton Tercentenary”. Plate manufactured by Frank Beardmore & Co in Fenton, England for The Geo. H. Bowman Co. based out of Cleveland and New York. Back of plate also stamped with the number “2” beside maker’s mark. Maker’s mark stamped on center of back.

Cover art designed by F.M. Hill. Book is bound with the saddle-stitch method.

did.unittitle: 8. Badges, Medals, and Pins

scopecontent.p: Various commemorative badges, medals, and pins relating to and created for The 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration Collection.

did.unittitle: Subseries 8.1: Badges and Medals

scopecontent.p: Commemorative badges and medals created for The 1909 Hudson-Fulton Celebration.

did.unittitle: HF Celebration Sterling Silver Official Medal of Commission #2

note.p: Toning along edges of each face, obverse and reverse, of medal.

scopecontent.p: Sterling silver medal featuring Henry Hudson and sailors aboard “Half-Moon” on obverse. Obverse reads “Discovery of Hudson River by Henry Hudson A.D. MDCIX,” bottom left reads “The American Numismatic Society,” bottom right reads “Hudson-Fulton Celebration Comm.,” bottom reads “Half Maene”. Reverse of medal depicts three female figures representing Steam Navigation, History, and Commerce below a portrait of Robert Fulton. The background features views of New York in 1807 and 1909. Reverse reads “First Use of Steam Navigation/ On The Hudson River/ 1807”. Metal designed by Emil Fuchs, whose name is signed in the bottom corner of each image on obverse and reverse. Medal originally presented to commissioners and principal guests.

did.unittitle: Circle of Friends of the Medallion Medal One #2

note.p: Slight tarnish over obverse and reverse side.

scopecontent.p: Bronze die-struck Hudson-Fulton Celebration commemorative medal issued by the Circle of Friends of the Medallion. The medal was the first in the series issued in 1909. The medal was designed and cast by John Flanagan (1865-1962). Front of metal features images of Hudson and Fulton. Obverse reads Henry Hudson/ Robert Fulton/ MDCIX”. Reverse of metal features image of female figure lying upon clouds, holding a lightbulb to symbolize the age of electricity. In the background are the “Half-Moon” and “Clermont” on the Hudson River before the New York City skyline. Back reads “MDCIX MDCCCVII/ MDCIX”. Outer box is maroon covered cardboard with fabric interior.

scopecontent.p: Black outer case with green interior. Case reads “Hudson Fulton Banquet/ September 29, 1909.” Obverse of medal features portrait of Peter Stuyvesant and dates “1592” and “1672”. Reverse features explanation for medal, as well as dates “1658” and “1908”. Along edges are names of towns including: Esopus, Wiltwyck, Kingston, The Strand, Waalfskill, and Roundout. Maker’s mark for Tiffany & Co. along reverse bottom edge.

MDCIX,” bottom left reads “The American Numismatic Society,” bottom right reads “Hudson-Fulton Celebration Comm.,” bottom reads “Half Maene”. scopecontent.p: Clothbound book-style presentation case featuring historical background on Hudson and Fulton’s journeys up the Hudson River. Cover features gold embossed logo of Circle of Friends of the Medallion with portrait of Pisanello at upper right of cover and number “1” on upper section of spine. Center of case contains bronze die-struck Hudson-Fulton Celebration commemorative medal issued by the Circle of Friends of the Medallion. The medal was the first in the series issued in 1909. The medal was designed and cast by John Flanagan (1865-1962). Front of metal features images of Hudson and Fulton. Obverse reads Henry Hudson/ Robert Fulton/ MDCIX”. Reverse of metal features image of female figure lying upon clouds, holding a lightbulb to symbolize the age of electricity. In the background are the “Half-Moon” and “Clermont” on the Hudson River before the New York City skyline. Back reads “MDCIX MDCCCVII/ MDCIX”. Medal and case are accompanied by papers regarding its history.

Reverse of medal depicts three female figures representing Steam Navigation, History, and Commerce below a portrait of Robert Fulton. The background features views of New York in 1807 and 1909. did.unittitle: Circle of Friends of the Medallion Medal One #3

note.p: Tarnish across both faces. Patina present along outer edges.

scopecontent.p: Bronze, die-struck Hudson-Fulton Celebration commemorative medal issued by the Circle of Friends of the Medallion. The medal was the first in the series issued in 1909. The medal was designed and cast by John Flanagan (1865-1962). Front of metal features images of Hudson and Fulton. Obverse reads Henry Hudson/ Robert Fulton/ MDCIX”. Reverse of metal features image of female figure lying upon clouds, holding a lightbulb to symbolize the age of electricity. In the background are the “Half-Moon” and “Clermont” on the Hudson River before the New York City skyline. Back reads “MDCIX MDCCCVII/ MDCIX”.

The instrument is missing three strings on the far right. There is a large crack in the back. Inside label has begun to peel off backing.

scopecontent.p: Wooden zither/Chickering harp with cherry wood stain. Bottom of front features a labelled scale for each string. Top left of instrument features a label that reads “Special/ Hudson-Fulton/ Model” below image of Hudson’s “Half-Moon.” Maker’s mark on inside cavity of instrument for Oscar Schmidt. Intricate design around center opening features images of harps and other string instrument. Outer box is black with label for Chickering harp along bottom edge of top half.

scopecontent.p: Commemorative Hudson-Fulton Quadricentennial envelope. Front features Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commemorative Cover art, including image of steamship under railway bridge in Poughkeepsie, NY. Commemorative stamp depicts Hudson and Fulton above images of “Half-Moon” and “Clermont. Cover art is overlaid by stamp for the Walkway Over the Hudson State Historic Park. The cover was sponsored by Ahsan & Associates, PLLC, Patent, Trademark, & Intellectual Property Law Firm. and stamp sponsored by Gellert & Klein, P.C., General Practice Law Firm.

did.unittitle: Hudson-Fulton Postal Puzzle Envelope

scopecontent.p: Intricately folded postal puzzle envelope featuring images in commemoration of Hudson-Fulton Celebration. Envelope also opens to reveal short history of Hudson and Fulton’s journeys up the Hudson River. Each corner of front features a flag from either France, Holland, Great Britain, or the US. On the inside, above short history, are images of both Hudson and Fulton, as well as the “Half-Moon” and “Clermont”.
